speaker: Forge
lines: Heat blooms from the mouth of the forge like sunrise with teeth.
Hammers speak a language of reasons; the anvil answers in periods.
Hooks hold tools that have names and tempers.
A quench trough dreams of steam and screams and both are true.
The smith does not look up; steel tells him who you are.
On a rack, blades that have not learned yet which fights they belong to.
On a wall, a childâ€™s drawing of a sword that looks like a river.
'Looking for steel or secrets?' he asks. 'We can forge either, but not both today.'

choices.text: Step to the counter and speak business.
Walk the forge floor and watch the work.
Ask the apprentices what they whisper when the bellows sigh.
